content:
That sounds like a great idea! A mysterious curse affecting a small village is a fantastic starting point for a beginner-friendly campaign. By using the Lost Mines of Phandelver adventure as a starting point, you'll have a solid foundation to build upon.

Adapting the adventure to fit your story will allow you to add your own twists and creative flair, making it more engaging and immersive for your players. Remember to keep the narrative simple and focused, with a clear goal and a compelling villain. This will help your players stay invested in the story and motivated to solve the mystery.

Incorporating elements from your friends' backstories is a great way to make the story more personal and engaging. This will give them a sense of ownership and connection to the narrative, making them more invested in the outcome.

Some additional suggestions to consider:

* Make sure to leave room for improvisation and flexibility in your story. This will allow your players to make choices and shape the narrative in unexpected ways.
* Use the curse as a way to create tension and suspense. You can have strange occurrences happen in the village, like unexplained noises, mysterious illnesses, or bizarre creatures appearing. This will create a sense of urgency and danger, motivating your players to solve the mystery.
* Consider having a variety of clues and leads for your players to follow. This will allow them to investigate and piece together the mystery, making them feel like detectives.
* Don't be afraid to add some humor and lighthearted moments to the story. A little bit of humor can go a long way in making the game more enjoyable and relaxing.

Overall, it sounds like you're on the right track. With a solid story, engaging characters, and a clear goal, you'll be well on your way to creating a fun and memorable campaign for your friends. Good luck, and have fun!
